subject: Science
title: Why Bones Don't Break Easily
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Bones Don't Break Easily.

hook.text: Bones are harder than concrete but lighter than steel. Nature engineered them perfectly.

buildup.text: Bones are made of collagen for flexibility and calcium minerals for hardness.

discovery.text: Without collagen, bones would be brittle. Without minerals, they'd be rubbery.

twist.text: Bones are alive. They constantly rebuild themselves â€” your skeleton replaces itself every 10 years.

climax.text: Astronauts lose bone density in space because without gravity, bones think they're not needed.

punchline.text: Your skeleton is alive and rebuilds itself every decade. You never have old bones.

quiz.question: How often does the human skeleton fully replace itself?
